meanings.definition: In a manner that shows fear or hatred of foreigners or strangers.
meanings.sent1: She looked at the new student xenophobically, unsure of their background.
meanings.sent2: He spoke xenophobically about people from other countries, making others uncomfortable.
meanings.sent3: The cat eyed the unfamiliar dog xenophobically, not used to visitors in its territory.
meanings.sent4: The old house creaked xenophobically in the presence of the unfamiliar guests.
meanings.sent5: The dark clouds gathered xenophobically, as if shunning the approaching storm.

meanings.definition: Showing or characterized by fear or hatred of foreigners or strangers.
meanings.sent1: The xenophobically charged remarks made everyone uneasy at the gathering.
meanings.sent2: Her xenophobically motivated actions isolated her from the diverse community.
meanings.sent3: The xenophobically decorated room had flags only from one country, ignoring the global theme.
meanings.sent4: The xenophobically painted fence seemed to keep out not just strangers but also kindness.
meanings.sent5: His xenophobically tinted glasses distorted his view of the world, making everything unfamiliar.
